intro: Rhinanthus crista-galli subsp. angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved common cranesbill, is a flowering plant in the family Violaceae. It is characterized by its slender, angular stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking pink or red flowers in racemes, typically blooming from June to August. It prefers sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and disturbed areas. This subspecies is notable for its role in supporting pollinators and its ornamental value in gardens.
